p: R. damascena oil is characterized by a high content of terpene alcohols, the majority of which is citronellol, followed by geraniol, nerol, and linalool. The relationship between them is also important. Oils with a citronellol/geraniol ratio of 2.5:4.3 [ 63] or 1.25:1.30 [ 64] are considered of high quality. The main hydrocarbons have a either a C 17, C 19, or C 21 skeleton [ 39].
